result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Joshua L Vinson in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Lloyd Baldwin in court for Joshua L Vinson.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a hearing regarding letter from DHS. State gives statement and answers questions of the court. Atty Baldwin gives statement and answers questions of the court. parties reach an agreement. Atty Baldwin is to submit a stip and order by the end of business day today reflecting ruling.
Affidavit in support of motion
Motion to transfer DE-Filed by the defense. STATE AND ATTORNEY BALDWIN ARE TO APPEAR AS SCHEDULED ON MONDAY SEPTEMBER 19TH AT 11:00 AM

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Joshua L Vinson in court, in custody.  Attorney appearing on behalf of Attorney Timothy Lloyd Baldwin in court for Joshua L Vinson.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a hearing regarding letter from DHS regarding that commitment is longer than maximum penalty for the most severe charge. ADA Nelson is not prepared to go forward with today's hearing. Defense attorney has been checking with other facilities that may be able to take the DE for treatment, however, defense is also not prepared for today's hearing. Court will set a hearing for Monday September 19th at 11:00 am. Atty Baldwin and an ADA with knowledge of this case and how to proceed must be present for the next hearing.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Joshua L Vinson in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Gawronski in place of Timothy Lloyd Baldwin in court for Joshua L Vinson.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. State makes statement. Atty Gawronski makes statement. Parties informed court that they have stipulated to a finding of incompetency based on Dr. Jackson's report. Off the record at 11:55 am to give Atty Gawronski time to go over Dr. Jackson's report with the defendant. Back on the record at 12:20pm. Appearances are the same as before. Court decides to move forward with hearing. Dr. Jackson appears by phone. Dr. Jackson is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Document 26 Dr. Jackson's report is marked offered and received. Defendant is removed from the courtroom. Atty with cross exam. State with re-direct. Court makes findings and grants request for finding of incompetency.  Court to sign order.
Competency hearing on September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Doctor is not available for today's hearing. Court will set over the competency hearing for a date that the doctor is available.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Timothy Lloyd Baldwin. Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is to file an amended complaint to reflect this. Court to issue an order for a competency exam.
